Key Match Events: Tyler O'Neill hit two home runs with three RBI to lead the Boston Red Sox to a 7-5 win against the Chicago White Sox.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox (32-111) are nine defeats shy of tying the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses since 1900 and are on pace to finish 36-126. The 1899 Cleveland Spiders hold the loss record at 20-134.
Others: Boston (72-70) won its second straight game after a five-game losing streak and trails Minnesota (76-66) for the AL's final wild card berth.
